subject: Fashion
title: Diversity in Fashion Campaigns
description: A short lesson to help you apply Diversity in Fashion Campaigns.

hook.text: In 2017, Edward Enninful became the first Black editor of British Vogue. His first cover: all Black models.

buildup.text: For decades, fashion campaigns overwhelmingly featured white, thin, young women. The data was stark.

discovery.text: After 2020's racial reckoning, brands rushed to cast diverse models. Campaign diversity doubled in one year.

twist.text: Critics called it 'tokenism.' Casting one Black model per campaign isn't diversityâ€”it's a quota.

climax.text: Real change means diverse photographers, designers, and editorsâ€”not just diverse faces in front of cameras.

punchline.text: Diversity isn't a casting choice. It's a power structure.

quiz.question: What criticism arose after brands rapidly increased model diversity in campaigns after 2020?
options: Diverse campaigns were less commercially successful than traditional ones
